When it comes to developing web applications, speed and efficiency are crucial. Tailwind CSS is a popular utility-first CSS framework that helps developers create custom designs without writing much CSS. However, even with Tailwind’s powerful features, building a polished and consistent UI can be time-consuming. This is where daisyUI comes in.

What is daisyUI?
daisyUI is a plugin for Tailwind CSS that provides a collection of pre-built, fully customizable components. It extends Tailwind’s capabilities by adding design systems and ready-made components like buttons, forms, cards, modals, and more. These components follow modern design principles and can be easily customized to match your application's theme.

Master DaisyUI Customization: A Complete Guide

Complete guide on customizing DaisyUI with any React project. Learn how to install and use DaisyUI, customize components, and create your own themes.

Highlights
🎯 Customize DaisyUI components and themes in your React project.

Key Insights
📚 DaisyUI offers a complete guide for customizing components, themes, and styles in React projects. This allows developers to create unique and personalized designs.
⚙️ By using the “data-theme” property, developers can apply different themes to specific components or elements, providing flexibility in design.
🎨 DaisyUI provides default options for colors, animations, borders, and more, allowing developers to easily customize the look and feel of their project.
🛠️ By using prefixes, developers can use DaisyUI and Tailwind CSS together, avoiding conflicts and creating a cohesive design system.
🌈 Creating custom themes and adjusting the default options allows developers to match their project’s style guide and create a consistent user experience.
📚 DaisyUI’s documentation provides detailed instructions and examples for customizing components, themes, and styles, making it easy for developers to implement these features in their projects.

Adding Notion Tailwindcss and DaisyUI to Svelte App

How to install DaisyUI in a WordPress theme. The first thing we need to do is install TailwindCSS in our WordPress theme. We do this by following the instructions on the TailwindCSS website. Once this is installed we can enqueue our new tailwind css file in our functions.php file within our theme. Once we have done this we need to head to the DaisyUI website to see what command we need to run. We copy and paste this command into our terminal to install DaisyUI. This should be in the root folder of our WordPress theme. Once this has been install we need to add it as a plugin in our tailwind config file (tailwind.config.js). Now we need to make sure our watch command is running so that tailwind will rebuild when we make any changes and everything should running smoothly, with DaisyUI installed! It's as easy as that.

Next.js 14 E-Commerce Website (Server Actions, TypeScript, Deployment, TailwindCSS, Prisma, DaisyUI)

Build and deploy a full-stack e-commerce website with Next.js and the new app router. 

This was originally a Next.js 13 tutorial. But since there are no API changes in Next.js 14, it's still completely up-to-date.

In this tutorial, you will learn:
-How to use Next.js server actions and call them from both server components and client components
-How to run database operations & transactions with Prisma and how to use Prisma client extensions to hook into your queries
-How to build a fully functional e-commerce website similar to Amazon.com
-How to add authentication with Next-Auth, the Prisma adapter, MongoDB, and Google login
-How to implement anonymous shopping carts for unauthenticated users and store the identifier in a cookie 
-How to build an amazing UI using TailwindCSS and DaisyUI
-How to deploy your project to Vercel and set up the metadata for each page (including generateMetadata)
-How to deduplicate Prisma requests using the React cache function
-How to set up tools like Prettier, Eslint, and the Prisma and TailwindCSS VS Code extensions to make your project easy to work with

Install and Configure DaisyUI in Next.js (Step-by-Step)

Not sure how to install the DaisyUI component library in your Next.js project? In this quick tutorial, I'll show you how to get DaisyUI installed and configured in a Next.js 13 project using the command line / terminal.

Setting up your Next.js project:

1. Create a new Next.js project with this command: npx create-next-app@latest [project-folder-name]

2. As part of the installation, choose "Yes" to install Tailwind CSS. Tailwind CSS is a dependency that DaisyUI needs to work properly in Next.js.

3. Clean up the defaut code in your page.js file.

4. Remove unused CSS styles (except the Tailwind directives at the top) from your globals.css file (see the full DaisyUI course link below if you need 
guidance on this).

Now, you should be ready to follow along with the video!

The short crash course covers the basics of DaisyUI's component library, and how we can best use them together with Tailwind CSS utility classes.

---

Ep5: Signup page with Directus SDK Auth + Svelte + Astro + DaisyUI - Video Tutorial Site in Directus

In this episode, we are going to create a custom signup endpoint in two ways: Extension Endpoint, and Extension Operation. They are both Directus Extensions, but how we use them is different. The operation will be used in Directus Flows, while the endpoint is a code change that requires deployment.

The main reason we are creating this endpoint is to allow anonymous users to get an invite (register) with the site. Normally an admin would have to kick this off from the Data Studio app.

🌼 DaisyUI Installation Guide - Learn to Supercharge Your Tailwind CSS Workflow 🚀

Welcome to Part 1 of our DaisyUI Crash Course! In this step-by-step tutorial, I, Dhruv Sood, a college student with a deep love for tech and frontend technologies, will guide you through the process of installing DaisyUI. DaisyUI is the utility-first CSS framework that seamlessly enhances your Tailwind CSS workflow.

🎯 What's Covered in Part 1:
- Introduction to DaisyUI and its benefits for speeding up UI development.

🚀 Tu Destino App
🔴​ Introduction
Tu Destino app is an application for booking, reservations, accommodation, house or apartment rental.
The main functionalities are reservations, payment platform (Paypal) and administrator dashboard for managing users and products.

Build a React - Express - MongoDB App
Implement services in MongoDB Atlas.
Use Scrum agile methodology.

🔺​ Front End:
HTML, CSS, Javascript, React, Redux, Cloudinary, Tailwindcss, Material UI.
Deploy: Vercel.com
Responsive Design

Node.js, Express, Mongoose, JWT
Deploy: Rawilway.app

🔺 ​Database:
MongoDB - Mongo Cloud Atlas

🔺​ Development Interface:
Visual Studio Code

Tailwindcss & Daisyui ~ Admin layout in yii2

In this tutorial, you will learn how to create a custom layout using TailwindCSS and DaisyUI in Yii2 framework. TailwindCSS is a utility-first CSS framework that helps you quickly build custom designs, while DaisyUI is a set of UI components that extend TailwindCSS. By combining these two tools, you can create beautiful and responsive layouts for your Yii2 application.
Join students of CSULB in learning React, TailwindCSS, and DaisyUI.

Barra de progresso com javascript puro - [Com DaisyUI]

Nessa aula você vai aprender a como criar uma barra de progresso dinâmica com javascript puro.

Para essa aula usarei o DaisyUI, que já vem como uma barra de progresso onde eu posso simplesmente mudar um valor na sua tag e com isso a barra de progresso aumenta ou diminui, de acordo com esse valor.

E com isso eu posso colocar os valores dinamicamente nessa tag, assim a barra vai aumentar o diminuir de acordo com o valor que eu coloque lá dinamicamente.

Nessa aula usei o javascript puro para fazer essa barra de progresso funcionar, nada de frameworks.

E se você gostar dessa aula não se esqueça de deixar seu like e se inscrever no canal.

TailwindCSS & Daisy UI - die perfekte CSS Library Kombination? - Installation & Basics

In diesem Video möchte ich euch DaisyUI vorstellen. Es ist eine Open Source Library, die auf den Utility Klassen von TailwindCSS aufbaut. Endlich die Flexibilität von Tailwind und vorgefertigte Komponents in einem Projekt nutzen. Ich zeige euch wie ihr das Ganze installiert und bei euch nutzen könnt.

TailwindCSS Installation: https://tailwindcss.com/docs/installation
DaisyUI: https://daisyui.com/

0:00 Warum DaisyUI
